description.en: Practical analytical chemistry: general aspects of analytical chemistry, gravimetry, titrimetry (acid-base, complexometric, redox), potentiometry, chromatography (GC and LC, GC-MS and LC-MS), atomic (AAS, AES, atomic mass spectrometry) and molecular spectroscopy (UV-Vis, IR and mass spectrometry), sampling, sample preparation, and principles of method validation and measurement uncertainty estimation.
description.et: Praktilised teadmised analüütilisest keemiast: proovi võtmine ja eeltöötlus, gravimeetria, titrimeetria, potentsiomeetria, kromatograafia, aatom- ja molekulspektroskoopia ning metoodikate valideerimise ja mõõtemääramatuse alused.

objectives.en: The goal of the course is to give an overview of the stages of chemical analysis from sampling to presentation of analytical results. Students are introduced to general principles of sampling and sample preparation and to analytical methods like gravimetry, titrimetry, potentiometry, chromatography (GC and LC, GC-MS and LC-MS), atomic (AAS, AES, atomic MS) and molecular spectroscopy (UV-Vis, IR and MS). An overview of method validation and measurement uncertainty is given.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade keemilisest analüüsi kõigist etappidest alustades proovivõtust kuni tulemuste esitamiseni. Käsitletakse proovivõtu ja eeltöötluse põhiprintsiipe ning erinevaid analüüsimeetodeid: gravimeetria, titrimeetria, potentsiomeetria, kromatograafia, aatom- ja molekulspektroskoopia ning massispektromeetria. Tutvustatakse analüüsimetoodikate valideerimise põhimõtteid ja mõõtemääramatuse aluseid.

learning_outcomes.en: - general principles of chemical analysis: analytical signal, noise, selectivity
learning_outcomes.et: - keemilise analüüsi üldprintsiibid: analüütiline signaal, müra, selektiivsus

learning_outcomes.en: - basics of method validation and measurement uncertainty estimation
learning_outcomes.et: - metoodikate valideerimise ja mõõtemääramatuse hindamise alused

learning_outcomes.en: - methods of chemical analysis (gravimetry, titrimetry, potentiometry, chromatography, spectroscopic methods) and the underlying processes (precipitation, chemical equilibria, transitions in molecules)
learning_outcomes.et: - keemilised analüüsimeetodid (gravimeetria, titrimeetria, potentsiomeetria, kromatograafia, spektroskoopilised meetodid) ja nende aluseks olevad protsessid (sadenemine, tasakaaludreaktsioonid, molekulisisesed üleminekud)

description.et: Test 2. There are theoretical questions based on the lecture materials and calculation problems. Theoretical part - the student expresses knowledge of facts from lecture materials and uses correct terminology. Calculation problems - the student calculates results of chemical analyses.

The final examination is based on a set of more than 150 questions which are already known to the students. The student describes the principles of operation of methods of analysis, uses schemes and knows the main properties. Compares various methods and can explain their disadvantages and advantages. Chooses a method for analytical tasks.

Test 1. There are theoretical questions based on the lecture materials and calculation problems. Theoretical part - the student expresses knowledge of facts from lecture materials and uses correct terminology. Calculation problems - the student can operate with atomic and molecular masses, using mole, mass units and different of concentration units the student calculates pH in weak or strong acid (base) solution and in buffer solution.

grade_preconditions.et: In order to be admitted to examination both tests have to be performed with scores not less than 50%.

grade_evaluation.et: The final score is formed on the basis of the examination answers (80%) and of two tests (10% each).

debt_elimination.et: It is possible to repeat both tests and the examination once.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
